roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses
Interface IEnergyHolder

All Known Implementing Classes:
Battery, RepairKit, Robot
public interface IEnergyHolder

The gameElement-classes who implement this interface will have an internal energy level.

Version:
24 may 2012
Author:
Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven
Invariants:
  • The energy level of each IEnergyHolder must be a valid energy level.
        this.canHaveAsEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND))
  • The maximum energy level of each IEnergyHolder must be a valid maximum energy level.
        this.canHaveAsMaxEnergy(this.getMaxEnergy())

    • Method Summary
     boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
              Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this IEnergyHolder.
     boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
              Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this IEnergyHolder.
     boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
              Checks whether the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder.

              Returns the variable representing the current amount if energy of this IEnergyHolder in the given energy unit.
     double getEnergyFraction()
              Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have.

              Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

    Method Detail

    isTerminated

    boolean isTerminated()

    getEnergy

    @Basic
double getEnergy(EnergyUnit unit)
    Returns the variable representing the current amount if energy of this IEnergyHolder in the given energy unit.

    Parameters:
    unit - The energy unit in which the returned energy amount will be expressed.

    setEnergy

    void setEnergy(double energyAmount)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Sets the amount of energy of this IEnergyHolder to the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

    Parameters:
    energyAmount - The new energy amount for this IEnergyHolder in watt-seconds [Ws].
    Precondition:
    The given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this IEnergyHolder.
        this.canHaveAsEnergy(energyAmount)
    Postcondition:
    The new amount of energy is equal to the given amount of energy.
        (new this).getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) == energyAmount
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] ...
        this.isTerminated()

    canHaveAsEnergy

    boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
    Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this IEnergyHolder.

    Parameters:
    energy - The amount of energy to be checked, expressed in Watt-second.
    Returns:
    False if the given energy is greater than or equal to the maximal amount of energy an IEnergyHolder can have.
        result != (energy > this.getMaxEnergy())
    Returns:
    False if the given energy is not a valid energy amount.
        result == EnergyAmount.isValidEnergyAmount(energy)

    getMaxEnergy

    @Basic
@Immutable
double getMaxEnergy()
    Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

    setMaxEnergy

    void setMaxEnergy(double maxEnergyAmount)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
    Sets the maximum energy level of this IEnergyHolder to the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

    Parameters:
    maxEnergyAmount - The new maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder in watt-seconds [Ws].
    Precondition:
    The given maximum energy level (in watt-seconds [Ws]) is a valid maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder.
        this.canHaveAsMaxEnergy(energyAmount)
    Postcondition:
    The new maximum energy level is equal to the given amount of energy.
        (new this).getMaxEnergy() == maxEnergyAmount
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this IEnergyHolder is terminated.
        this.isTerminated()
    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - [CAN] When the maximum energy level of this IEnergeHolder cannot be altered.
        ! (this instance of Robot)

    canHaveAsMaxEnergy

    boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
    Checks whether the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder.

    Parameters:
    maxEnergy - The maximum energy level to be checked, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
    Returns:
    False if the given energy isn't a valid energy amount
        result == EnergyAmount.isValidEnergyAmount(maxEnergy)

    getEnergyFraction

    double getEnergyFraction()
    Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have.

    Returns:
    A percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have.
        result == (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)) / this.getMaxEnergy()) * 100

    recharge

    void recharge(double amount)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
    Recharges this IEnergyHolder with the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].

    Parameters:
    amount - The amount of energy to be added to this IEnergyHolder, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
    Precondition:
    This IEnergyHolder can be recharged with the given amount of energy.
        this.canAcceptForRecharge(amount)
    Effect:
    The given amount of energy is added to the current amount of energy (expressed in Watt-second [Ws]) this IEnergyHolder has.
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + amount)
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this IEnergyHolder is terminated.
        this.isTerminated()

    canAcceptForRecharge

    boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
    Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this IEnergyHolder.

    Parameters:
    amount - The amount to be checked, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
    Returns:
    False if this IEnergyHolder cannot have a total energy level equal to the given amount of energy added to its current energy level.
        result == (this.canHaveAsEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + amount))
    Returns:
    False if the given amount of energy is a not valid energy amount
        result == EnergyAmount.isValidEnergyAmount(amount)

    transferEnergy

    void transferEnergy(IEnergyHolder other,
                    double amount)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
    Transfers the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], from this IEnergyHolder to another IEnergyHolder.

    Parameters:
    other - The IEnergyHolder to be given energy.
    amount - The amount of energy to be transferred, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
    Preconditions:
  • The IEnergyHolder must be able to accept the amount of energy to be transferred.
        other.canAcceptForRecharge(amount)
  • The amount to be transferred [Ws] can not be greater than the amount of energy this IEnergyHolder has [Ws].
        amount <= this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)
    • Effects:
  • The IEnergyHolder is recharged with amount of energy to be transferred.
        other.recharge(amount)
  • The transferred amount of energy [Ws] is subtracted from the amount of energy of this IEnergyHolder.
        this.setEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) - amount);
    • Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this IEnergyHolder or the other IEnergyHolder is terminated
        this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()
    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - [CAN] When this IEnergyHolder cannot transfer energy to another IEnergyHolder
        ! this instanceof Battery
